page.title: 19Memories of Wakefield (cont)
page.content: Famous people in Wakefield this century are the novelists{George {Gissing and David Storey} and the sculptress{Barbara Hepworth.}The two main buildings to have been extended are{Wakefield Prison}which now houses many IRA convicts,and{Pinderfields {Hospital}which is famous for its burns unit.The past twelve months has seen major development in the towh centre with the building of the{Ridings {Centre}which has been voted the best European indoor shopping centre. Having lived in Wakefield for sixty years the ex-deputy head of our school says that the three major things to have had an impact on her life would be,personally, the invention of televisison,and,less personally,space travel and the micro-chip.One wonders what replies will be fifty years hence.
